author: {'steamid': '76561198824302304', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 552, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1707494777}
review:
Funny looking tower edfense, after the first 25 levels or so it gets interesting. And with 60 levels the game doesn't have much content, the last few hours from my gametime are for grinding the last achievement.
Veggie mode which is mentioned in the features is just a little bit of a reskin and not a new gamemode, the bosses are not very interesting or 'insane' and the story isn't interesting either. But on a sale it's something you could consider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004143305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 9387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9325, 'last_played': 1706667000}
review: This game allows you to select the most adorable gophers to aid in defeating dinosaurs who want to steal your food! There are eleven kinds of towers used to combat dinos, as well as a few power-ups for extra damage! Oh, and watch out for some super-sized bosses that appear on occasion.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3869, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 2806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1705774039}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985209709', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1700346245}
review:
A very, very good tower defense game that fully embraces its puzzle roots.
The cartoony graphics and wonderfully corny one-liners mask how deceptively hard this game can get at times. There are some elvels which I can only describe as "F You" levels. Still, once you learn a certain levels pattern, you can figure out the puzzle pieces pretty quickly. This is not to say that you can be lazy, however; battlefield management is key. You have to constantly be keeping an eye out for WHERE the dinosaurs ARE and HOW MANY HITS any certain weapon would take to kill them. Things get ultra spicy because the more you build, the less room Coconut Trees (weapon currency) have to grow. 

The only downside is that certain level paths require certain weapons, which can be confusing and difficult when combined with the levels that lock in specific weapons.

Where the hell is the sequel?

author: {'steamid': '76561199028756730', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1700253460}
review: Cute, decent, tower defense that has some challenging levels sprinkled in. Looks like a mobile game though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022961386', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1699032699}
review:
Pretty typical tower defense, except you need to collect coconuts with your character to buy towers and the towers have a shape, so you need to think a little where to put them. There's maybe 4-5h worth of levels, most of those easy enough to pass with first try, unless you try to get full points. 

I've played better games and worse games, going to give thumbs up, because there's nothing wrong with it, but didn't feel in anyway special either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986527965', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1680413436}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs is a cutesy tower defense game where you need to stop dinosaurs from stealing your steaks.

It uses a card system for powers up and for towers that have a polyomino placement system. Your character also attacks the dinos while moving around to collect coconuts (money) and breaking rocks.

On the downside, most of this is pretty easy and there isn't anything that new here. There are a few levels that are fairly difficult and will likely require multiple plays or differing strategies.

Not sure if this was intentional or not, but when the Stegosaurus comes out, sometimes he makes a sound that reminds me of Clay Davis from the Wire saying "Sheeee.eeeeit". I found it amusing each time.

It's nothing special, but it's a decent enough tower defense game to play for a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008984799', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1682891318}
review:
Nice tower defence game. 
Not very hard, but is still challenging to get the 3 â€œsteaksâ€ in every map. 
I like tower defence games, but they are often very hard and frustrating (thinking about kingdom rush, for example). On this one, it doesn't take long to finish a map, so you can just restart.
The theme is funny, and the graphics are pretty. 
It doesn't have too much replayability. I guess in around 15h you can 100% the achievements.
I don't usually write reviews, but this one deserves it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037162452', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1682620729}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs! is a fun and light-hearted game that's perfect for kids and young gamers. The comic-style graphics are charming and add to the overall lighthearted tone of the game. The levels are plentiful, and players will have plenty of content to explore and enjoy.

One of the standout features of the game! is that it doesn't take itself too seriously. The game is filled with humor and doesn't try to be something it's not. This makes it fun and enjoyable gaming experience that's perfect for casual play.

However, one downside to the game is that it can be a bit too easy at times. Experienced gamers may find the levels to be a breeze and lack a significant challenge. Additionally, once the campaign is cleared, there's not much to do in terms of replayability.

Overall, this game is a fun and perfect for kids and young gamers. While it may lack the challenge and replayability that some more experienced gamers are looking for, the game's humor and charm make it a worthwhile addition to any game library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025518269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1700722713}
review:
You know what? I was pleasantly surprised. I'm going through my Steam backlog, and didn't even know what this game was, and that kind of makes me sad to think how many other hidden gems are out there people may not know of. It's not going to win any awards or be remembered fondly in history, but I think it's passable and it has a lot of unique qualities.

This is a tower defense game, and I found it to be a lot of fun. One of the major things that sets it apart from other games I've played in the genre is how snappy it is. Each round lasts a minute or two, compared to the grueling pace of other games. The game is much more exciting with you controlling where the main character and can zip around, and it's much less frustrating losing a minute than ten or fifteen.

Super hardcore players might have gripes with the balancing of the game, but I'm not analytical enough to be upset if the game isn't ultra strict.

The graphics are extra crispy. Burnt to a crisp. For some reason all the artwork looks extremely digitally over-sharpened, and it definitely makes the game look weird, but at the same time makes you feel like you're in an action game and just shot up some pain killers.

It looks like a crappy mobile game, and it isn't the prettiest games in terms of art direction, but it has a lot of compelling game design choices and I kept coming back to it until I beat it. It gets quite challenging at the end.

review: As a fan of tower defense games I did not enjoy Go Home Dinosaurs. All round presentation is very good. Unfortunately, the game just isn't much fun. The cartoon graphics are so big that they take up too much room on screen. There are too few places to put towers and there's a pointless need to move around collecting coconuts and sweeping up coins during game-play. It's really a casual game and that's what I expected but I'm not going to waste any more time after getting bored early on.

review:
I have played this game many times, and beaten it many times. Itâ€™s a perfect mix of Tetris and TD that is rarely implemented, if ever. It does this well. This is the kind of game you get the craving to play through fully every few years or less.

I have been craving a sequel for years, but itâ€™s pretty evident that is wishful thinking given how long the game has been out without any successor. Hopefully it inspires another creator to create such a unique and fun TD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121112670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1664925149}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs is a dated, casual tower defense game about gophers protecting their bbq from dinos.  Got over halfway through and put it down after 2.8 hours of playing (guesstimating you can beat it in 6 hours).  Played using a mouse.  Difficulty is medium.  Good game for kids.  Got this as part of the Ukraine humble bundle.

Gameplay - There is a track the dinosaurs run on until they reach the BBQ at the end and eat it.  You throw rocks at them to make them go away.  You can also grab coconuts and it takes x many coconuts to summon in helper gophers with individual dino-deterring abilities.  Every once in a while a bunch of dino-coins fall about and you collect them to get more abilities or costumes from an in-game shoppe.  

Strategy - The gopher helpers each take up a tetris-piece-style set of squares and it's your job to fit them into the grid as best you can while the dinosaurs swarm in and gradually overwhelm everything.  The strategy lies in summoning them, fitting them into place, fighting off dinos, and collecting coconuts before time runs out.  You'll be kept busy the entire time.

Worlds - There are 3 worlds, each with 20 levels.  The levels get harder the further you go.

Mobile Game - This plays a lot like a mobile game.  A Lot.  This is the sort of game I'd see on the Nintendo DS for car trips.  

Music - It's there.  Don't remember any of it.  

Story - What story?  There's a bbq, and gophers, and dinosaurs.  

Graphics - Dated claymation-style graphics.  The dinosaurs definitely have character and I had no trouble telling what gopher helper did what.  One steggo looks like his tongue is poking out his forehead in the menu, and that's supposed to be a mohawk or something.  

In-Game Shoppe - There is a shoppe in Go Home Dinosaurs where you use in-game coins to buy costumes and gopher friends. This is not a real shop and they don't ask for real money.  

Bugs - Experienced a few bugs.  The game crashed on me more than once, sometimes for what seems like no reason.  The worst crash was when it froze on the menu screen and didn't show up as an exe when I ctrl/alt/deleted.  Hard closing steam entirely closed it.  I think this specific crash happened because I loaded it through the steam library and not off my desktop with the icon (which I did most of the time and didn't experience the same crash).  

 

I wanted to play this to beat it originally, but Go Home Dinosaurs is the sort of game you play casually once-in-a-while and not all-in-one-go.  As it is, I got bored towards the end of World 2 and grew antagonized by the sound effects and repeated quirky one-liners from the gophers.  Don't get me wrong, there is a nice game here with a variety of powers and dinosaurs to fight off.  If I was 10 years old and stuck in a car for a 6 hour drive with a steamdeck at my disposal, I'd play the crap out of this game.  It's just not the game for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198807311957', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1665956579}
review:
Good game. 
It's easy to complete, not too long or repetitive with unique levels, and it's a fair challenge if you want to get the 100% of the game.
The only problem is that if you want to go for all achievements, the 10k dinos sent home one will take you a while of grinding, because completing the game only leaves you with half of those more or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198965837789', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 3011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3011, 'last_played': 1663267572}
review:
I have not played many tower defence games, but compared to Bloons TD 6, this game is much inferior. Graphics and soundtrack are childish, and gameplay has many holes within it:
- The levels are quite repetitive, especially between the different worlds.
- There is no strategy that you can use. Just get one or two dinosaur cards and fill the rest with TNT Barrels.
- The game is very easy that it becomes boring to play like a casual clicker game.
- The features are very limited. You cannot modify your towers nor upgrade them.
- The money that you grab does not affect the live game, so there is no interest to make a strategy around farming money.
And many other things. Overall underwhelming. Not recommended unless you want to introduce your kids to tower defence games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972860008', 'num_games_owned': 1720, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1698061540}
review:
[h1] AT A GLANCE [/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*][b] Game Name: [/b] Go Home Dinosaurs!
[*][b] Original Release: [/b] 2013-03-14
[*][b] Genre Tags: [/b] Strategy, Tower Defense
[*][b] Estimated Playtime (Campaign): [/b] 10-12 hours
[*][b] 100% Achievements Playtime: [/b] 14-16 hours
[*][b] DLC Required for 100% Achievements: [/b] N/A
[*][b] Multiplayer Aspect: [/b] None
[*][b] Replayability: [/b] None
[*][b] Recommended To: [/b] Casual Gamers, Achievement Hunters, Kids
[/list]

[h1] REVIEW [/h1]
[b]  Go Home Dinosaurs! [/b] is a strategy, tower defense game.  

The gophers are trying to have an epic barbeque but they keep getting interrupted by Todd Rexâ€™s dinosaurs.  Your goal is to eliminate the dinosaurs before they make it to your barbeque grill and ruin it for you and all your gopher friends.

The game is fairly easy, but there are some maps that may require additional plays to get a 3-star rating. Play time is ~14-16 hours to get all achievements. Grinding maps to get coins to unlock tower items from the store may be needed before and after you finish the main campaign.  There is NO replayability on this game as there is no end game mechanics, no map metrics to try to beat, and no engrossing story to return to. While the fact that the game feels like a once and done kind of game; I do recommend it to anyone new to tower defense games or is an achievement hunter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11126, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1662279286}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs! is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as a cash grab by greedy mobile devs.  It's a cutesy low poly tower defense game for children where you place little critters (the towers) who defend your bbq from the dinosaurs who run along a path wanting to eat your steak.  Ok.  The game was on app stores but seems to have been removed by Apple, it's unclear why.  

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

The game features lazy low-polygon "retro" assets, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the 1990s.  It's unclear why the developers weren't able to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets for the game, and also irrelevant... what matters is that this looks bad as a result of their decisions, a compromise PC gamers shouldn't have to put up with.

Because this is a mobile app, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the iPhones that the game was designed for.  These are unfortunate handicaps and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was an afterthough for the iPhone developers who are to blame for this.  The game is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for mobile phones forces upon a game.  Once more, mobile devs have made gaming worse for everyone.  I didn't spend thousands on building a gaming rig just so I could pretend it's an iPhone.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Go Home Dinosaurs! has a laughable, eye watering price of $10 USD, for which you could easily get any number of older AAA games, let alone the sheer number of free games available on Steam.  Given the defects and shortcomings, it's impossible to recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043844180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1662252743}
review: Fun yet simple-to-pickup tower defence. New options are introduced at a manageable pace so you don't feel overwhelmed. Some levels were definitely challenging but the ease of playability made it enjoyable to return over and over again. The bonus achievements were also a fun challenge. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046595924', 'num_games_owned': 4770, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1661750399}
review:
My Video Review is available here:
https://youtu.be/C84ZGj1HRW8

Is Go Home Dinosaurs the game that can drag your attention in the style â€œjust one more level and I will go to sleepâ€ or will it become boring and repetitive soon? I have found many pros in this game - humorous story, instant and fast gameplay, direct control over the main character, system of inventory and cards, interesting tower types, good level design, variable and funny enemies, user friendly interface and controls, reasonable difficulty, beautiful graphics and great sounds along with funny dubbing. Go Home Dinosaurs is not a flawless game indeed so here are the cons - no upgrades for your towers, not very useful shop, low variability of the game environment and one can find the game mechanics maybe too simplistic.

Pros: 
- story
- instant gameplay
- control over the main character
- cards and inventory
- tower types
- level design
- variety of enemies
- interface and controls
- difficulty
- graphics and sounds

Cons:
- no upgrades for towers
- shop
- variability of the game environment
- simplistic game mechanics
- base price

I have enjoyed the time spent with Go Home Dinosaurs and it dragged me in for quite a long time thanks to the dynamic gameplay and if it wouldnâ€™t be so simplistic when it comes to tower upgrades and shop I would give it an even higher mark. Like this I am giving the game Thumbs Up and VideoGaming Fatherâ€™s Index 7+ out of 10 - recommended but with some discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001533758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1660363171}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988662571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1660488837}
review:
Not recommended.
Boring, repetitive, loud and sometimes obnoxious.
Difficulty varies wildly but mostly on the easy side.

May freeze on startup and leaves you with no other option but signing off / restarting pc.

(game was gotten "for free" though humble bundle)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994851017', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1648948245}
review:
If you just have to absolutely play a new tower defense game, i wouldn't say "never play it, worst game ever". It was just "meh".
Personally I wasn't a fan of the really childish graphics, and the difficulty level was basically "baby's first tower defense". Maybe half the towers are great. The other half you'll get, be forced to use one level followed by another level that's shaped specifically for that tower, and then the routes will go back to shapes that the better towers you've been using just do better on. The powers for the main character were the same for me - I think besides a few times using them specifically for an achievement, they just collected dust since they cost tower prices while only being temporary.
Frankly I played through it as something to do during a long podcast lol. I dont think it would have held my interest by itself.

review:

 Nach 5 Lvln crasht das Spiel jedesmal. Teilweise hat es den Rechner dabei so abgewÃ¼rgt dass nur ein radikaler Kaltstart geholfen hat. Nein Danke!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026068022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1656144408}
review:
It's cute, it's a tower defense with tetrimino-shaped units that you strategically put in right places to maximize the damage output (the "tetris" part of the puzzle starts to really shine, once you'll unlock all the pieces and attempt to 100% all of the levels)
As with any tower defense games you're occasionally one shot away from the failure, so it's nail-biting stressful from time to time, but even such a TD scrub like me managed to 5-star all the challenges (not least of all thanks to consumable boosts 
& power-ups that often let you brute force your way out of a tight situation)

One thing that didn't work quite right was the cursor positioning in fullscreen (where the cursor points a few dozen of pixels lower than it actually shows [spoiler]- my guess it has something to do with the window top frame getting somehow not factored in in cursor capturing area... or something like that[/spoiler]) that I worked around by running the game in windowed mode.

Overall - it's pretty good. Really liked the seamless blend of 2D and 3D assets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198998779305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1654275961}
review:
(Received via Humble Bundle)

Go Home Dinosaurs (GHD) is a great romp for a Tower Defence game. The game is, as ever, simple but frustration will set in at only being able to do so much at one time.

The graphics are cute, some of the comments made are great (with a nice nod to Full Metal Jacket) and the music is forgettable but not annoying.

It won't take long to complete, really, but I recommend staying for the achievements and becoming smarter about your layouts.

My only wish is for keyboard shortcuts for choosing your weapons instead of having to use the mouse to move up and then left-click; this would make it more fluid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000689633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1650924286}
review:
Summary: C [Recommended with caveats.] Go Home Dinosaurs has the appearance of being cute and fuzzy, but the challenge builds up in later levels. If you enjoy tower defense games, this is a solid buy. If you are new to tower defense games, you may want to look for alternatives that are more forgiving.

Review:
While the game looks cute and starts off easy, the difficulty ramps up to the point of being nasty during the later levels. If you are new to tower defense games, GHD could end up being an exercise in frustration. I found there was a core set of towers that were of use and the rest I only touched when required to. Having only a few towers that seemed to be of use also added to the annoyance factor due to the quips the units would spout being uttered way too often.

Overall, GHD is a good but odd entry into the tower defense realm. While it has a cartoonish appearance, it has no issue with running you over if you do not spot the gimmick involved with some of the maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347448171', 'num_games_owned': 1177, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1650202987}
review:
I got the game for free as a gift. 

It's a tower defense game with chipmunks? defending their barbecue from invading dinosaurs, but unlike Plants vs. Zombies, here positioning your units is key and not reversible and how many units and of what kind is always limited, from what I've seen so far, plus moving the one unit you can is very frantic because he has basic attacks and must also collect resources around the map to get more units.

A nice idea and presentation, but too unforgiving and frantic for me.


P.S. There should be a comma in the title, so: "Go Home, Dinosaurs!" since you're addressing said dinos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1648791223}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs is a rather basic tower defense where you cannot upgrade the towers, cannot sell/destroy/relocate placed towers, and you rarely get to place a large number of towers. All that said, the game was far more enjoyable for me than I expected it to be. Where the game really shone for me was the cute enemy designs and the unique tower "shapes." Effectively, each tower has a different shape, sort of like Tetris pieces (though some have 2, 5, 7, etc. pieces rather than 4. So you can't just find a "this tower combination is best" scenario on most of the maps, as the developer has created maps where certain towers won't fit at all, or just one tower will monopolize an area which could otherwise fit three or four towers, and so forth. It was pretty darn clever in my opinion.

Ultimately, the game is nothing amazing, but it certainly was something pleasant/entertaining to do with reduced game volume while listening to YouTube news videos in the background and such. It you're bored, like tower defenses, and want something okay but not great to play that is probably worth ~$5, then Go Home Dinosaurs isn't a terrible choice.

review: The sound effects grate on my nerves, especially some of the dialogue, and it's incredibly unfair by sending large packs of dinosaurs within the first five seconds of the game before you even have the chance to pick up any coconuts and build up your defenses. The ice tower is also useless as it only slows down one dinosaur when you have like 5-6 compies marching on down the path. I do think the mechanic where you can place yourself around the map and help out is interesting, and I like that, however it's just not enough to keep me playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158898955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1648510219}
review:
I got this as a gift from my bf, since it has some of the cutest dinosaurs (too bad they're excluded from the BBQ, hahah!). I gave it a try and got hooked fast. I still have some levels left, but I will be playing those when I need a break from other games. 

Some positives:
+ It was more fun and engaging than I was expecting. 
+ Art style is very appealing, my favorite is again, the dinos! I could almost have one paragraph just for praising their designs. You can buy some 'skins' for your character.
+ I like that there's a vegan option (altho' it has to be bought from the shop).

+ I like that you can complete the levels with the pieces you wish, and even go back to the old levels with the new upgrades. Although, some levels are obviously built for certain pieces and power ups, I found it made the puzzles more challenging and fun. For example, I replayed one level a lot to get the most efficient combination in order to get the 3/3 "Meats" (aka star rating system). Some levels I have not cared to replay, yet. 

Some nitpicks:
- Sometimes the levels require a lot of attention, so you have to keep clicking a lot with no break. You can buy 'extra helpers' to do some of this for you. But it's kinda hard sometimes to spare the extra slot for it (not complaining, it helps balance the game!).
- I personally didn't find any use for the temporary explosive power up. I didn't really get its' purpose.  

I don't have much experience of similar games, but I think this game does the "build and defense" simply and well. Would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994679213', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1648058088}
review: Super casual TD. There are 3 zones with 20 levels each and your typical 3 star rating system. Around 5-10 hrs depending on if you go for the achievements or not. At the start of each map you'll look at the grid layout and enemy pool and equip fitting towers and spells based on that. During the game palm-trees spawn and you collect them for the currency to build. It's pretty simple and and casual, not much challenge outside of one or two levels. Good title for children and anyone who wants a cutesy TD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034023284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1648004363}
review:
Surprisingly addictive but disappointingly short.
I got this for cheap through Humble bundle but for $11 Canadian on Steam there should be at least twice as many levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198961246089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1691125365}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs is a pleasant surprise; I honestly thought it would play and look like a mobile game. By the second level, I had a complete change of heart. 

Go Home Dinosaurs is what I would consider an introduction to tower defense games. The traps are simplistic enough that anyone can understand them, and the game does not require much reading. 

Go Home Dinosaurs can become complex as you progress through the various levels. However, it is not that deep. I love tower defense games, but this one did not have enough depth to keep me interested. 

I can, however, recommend this to anyone who wants to dip their toes in the genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979282685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1647742215}
review:
While the theme is cute and the implementation reasonably solid, it's a very generic tower defense game with no particularly original features. If you just can't get enough tower defense then it'd be an alright choice, but GemCraft or Curator Defense are more interesting (or any where what you build changes the path, giving more of a sense of strategy). There isn't much variation in the enemies (just speed and health basically) and all towers impact all things equally, so in this one strategy is a simple matter of splash damage when there's many small things, focused damage when there's fewer large things, repeat forever.

The one slightly interesting thing is that the towers have different shapes, so there's a slight tetris-planning aspect to it, but that mostly ends up just being slightly annoying, when you unthinkingly place a tower slightly differently than you had planned and now you can't place everything you intended to.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977080684', 'num_games_owned': 4277, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1632018224}
review:
I really liked this quirky tower defense game. The dinosaur/vegetable gimmick didn't really draw mean in and I kinda could care less. But what was good was the tower defense aspect. The game actually does a pretty good job of balancing different tower types with enemies to keep you on your toes. Tower placement is critical and not always easy as every tower demands a specific footprint in terms of size and dimension. You can't just plop down towers wherever you want! 

The game is pretty easy. There are a few later levels that are challenging. Also, I got plenty of playtime for this game, so it's a pretty good value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053573780', 'num_games_owned': 1721, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1307, 'last_played': 1625762875}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs is a tower-defense (or in this case, BBQ defense) game with adorable graphics, witty one-liners & was completely enjoyable from start to finish. If you're into TD games, I highly recommend you put this one into your wishlist, library, whatever. It's worth it!

Gameplay is great. It's even difficult so you know this isn't "a kid's game". Just because the graphics are adorable doesn't mean it is for kids! I just love all the dinosaurs and even more so when they do a dance.

Good music: adds nice ambiance to the game as you play it.

There isn't exactly a 'story' as some videos when you defeat each world, which are nice. You definitely replay thisâ€¦ mostly because you're farming 10,000 dinosaurs for an achievement, but the game is really fun, too.

I recommend this game if you're into tower defense style games, as this does provide some challenges with correct placements and collecting coconuts before you can even make defenses!

Some levels provide quite a challenge and that was a really fun twist for me.

You can read my review with game stats here: https://jaderexeverythingsite.wordpress.com/2021/12/11/go-home-dinosaurs-game-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198128371609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1620872787}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs is a straight forward clean tower defense game where you place towers of different shapes to intercept dinos on a path to take your BBQ.  You start off with only one tower, but you continuously get more as you progress through the game.  The unique thing this game has compared to other TD games in the genre is that the towers you place have shapes that take up different areas on a floor, and because of varying level layouts will force you to strategize and determine what are the most efficient spots to put each tower down.  Once you place a tower, you cannot remove it from the board in the current level.

Overall, Go Home Dinosaurs is on the easier side of things when compared to other TD games so is perfect for sitting back and relaxing or if you are wanting something to ease yourself into tower defense as a whole.  This game does not have a fast forward function, something that is worth noting for those a little more experienced.  The levels are fairly short however and range anywhere between 2-4 minutes a pop so the game never really feels like it drags on at any point.

In the audio department, the music and sounds won't blow your socks off but they feel suitable for the task at hand so no real complaints there.

This is a game that is good for anyone really, and it's clear that the developers are into video games as a whole due to some of the pop culture references that will appear along the way.  All in all, worth the purchase and completing it 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155480176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1703138202}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038123440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1585763994}
review:
Short Version:
Pros:
+ Good for kids
+ Art style is somewhat pleasant
+ Arsenal and enemy variety

Cons:
- Too easy
- Grows boring after a while
- Level grids are too small

â€œLongâ€ Version:
[u]Go Home Dinosaurs![/u] is a tower-defense game with light puzzle elements. It was developed and published by Fire Hose Games. You play as a group of squirrels that must fight in order to protect their BBQ.

Story is almost non-existent â€“ you get a few images with some text but nothing to write home about.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1346634866
Gameplay is serviceable. You must choose and place towers throughout a predetermined path in order to stop the dinosaurs from reaching your barbecue. The twist here is that each tower has a different shape and the player must optimize tower placements to avoid running out of space and in order to 3-star some levels.
My biggest problem with this mechanic is how small the levels and, subsequently, how big the towers feel. I found myself picking the biggest, most powerful towers with the smaller ones, usually not having enough space for anything in-between. Some towers are downright useless. Some are a must-pick in most cases.
While you get introduced to new towers, power-ups and enemies regularly, you will mostly stick to the same strategies. You will usually have an easier time if you use the new towers right as they are introduced, as these levels are geared towards that specific pick; but after that, you are good to go back to the same old routine. The Laser tower, for example, occupies a long horizontal line on the grid and it is just not viable - you cannot even place it, most of the time.
I would say the game is fun but only in short doses. It gets really repetitive.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1346737581
Graphics are up next. They are cartoony and kid friendly. The whole game looks like a modern Saturday morning cartoon for a younger audience.

Music is very forgettable. Sound effects are crisp and goofy, which fits the whole aesthetic.

While [u]Go Home Dinosaurs[/u] is definitely not for me, as I am not its target demographic, I can see kids finding it enjoyable and it being fun to play as a family. The game is too easy for the most part for adults but I believe kids will enjoy breezing through most levels.
I should also mention that there are way better tower defense games on Steam that are still suitable for kids and that feature better mechanic implementation and offer more replay value.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1347146559
I would recommend it when on a sale (>75% off) if you need something to entertain younger kids.

Final score: 6 out of 10.

If you enjoyed this review, please consider joining my [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/goodguynickreviews]group[/url] and following my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7792954-GGN-Reviews/]curator page[/url] on Steam.

review:
It's just a cute tower defense game keeping dinos away from your dinner. For the amount of effort these gophers put into defending their grub, they could probably just make more food instead. 
My kids love it and I like it, too. It does have just enough difficulty later for the "Dad, get three stars on this level for us".

author: {'steamid': '76561197969249537', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1682505326}
review: This game is damn great! so much for it being released in 2013, i got this in 2020! this is kind of a cross over of plants vs zombies, and another tower defence games mixed together perfectly into this confined space of 2013. I recommend this game because of how fun it is to play, get's addicting after awhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052263435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1665640490}
review:
This Tower Defence is quite reminiscent of Plants Vs. Zombies. It's cute, funny, kid-friendly but requires some thought and decision making to win. It's not the hardest (I think to many TD games are made to get to hard to quickly anyway), but getting 3 stars (3 steaks) in each mach will take some time and effort. 

Overall I am really enjoying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046450713', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1558482738}
review: If you like tower defense games and you're 12, this just might be a game for you. As tower defense games go, this isn't anything new or ground breaking. The player character gopher guy is a semi new idea but it doesn't give me much of anything to come back for. The concept is pretty simple; grab the resource, use it to make towers, kill the enemy units before they get to the end of the path. I can't say that this is bad because it's mechanically solid and runs fine. I just can't say it stands out above any other game. It feels like a flash game with a budget that took a year or two to make. Get it on sale if it really looks like fun to you but don't expect anything too fun or new.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035114506', 'num_games_owned': 2094, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1575661850}
review:
I really wanted to write a good review, but the last achievement just killed any joy I had from playing this game, because I spent 3 f***ing hours grinding the same level over, and over, and over again just to get it.

Well, all in all, this game is pretty good for people like me, who don't like complex TD games where they ask you to build a corridor so the enemies will take the longer path, BUT if you block off everything they just start going through walls for no apparent reason other than "we wanted to make the gameplay harder". Yeah.

Half of the towers are just useless most of the time, special mention goes to the laser, which you flat out CAN'T EVEN PLACE on half the levels, and on the other half it's mostly useless. Power-ups - didn't even use them. Except the TNT, it will save your @$$ (steam, stop censoring my reviews).

Well, despite everything I said, I still recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009064372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1553462015}
review:
Due to the low price (especially if on sale) I can recommend it but for TD fans you will get bored, and fast.  Their tetris like tower design was a good idea but it comes w/ too many drawbacks.  Most towers are only effective when they fit perfectly into the space they have.  Levels are generally fairly straight paths making some shapes highly impractical to use.  You are also highly limited on space so support towers (especially the stun tower shaped _|_ ) will never be used because you can't a space and even if you did the value of it for the space taken up isn't worth it.

Also worth mentioning they have a favorite for players which is a teleporter to warp single unit leaks from getting to the end of the maze.  So no worries about that one giant unit that leaked right? Wrong.   The shape of the tower is 2 space 2 spanning over the path, so unless the path near end of the maze has no turns near it you cannot use it.  Also if end is along an edge of the map you can't use it since half of it would fall out of bounds.  

Next you have Powers which use same cost as the towers (which is fine) but you can only bring a very limited amnt of cards and Powers and Towers both count as cards.  So do you bring a permanent tower, or a temporary power up?  No brainer there so you will generally ignore the power ups existence.

Flaws aside what we end up w/ is a really limited choice tower game that is properly balanced.  Because it is balanced and we have few choices though, you will find it extremely easy and be 3 starring most maps on the first try.  It appears to be 60 levels long and I got bored after around 30 since I'm doing the same thing over and over, but for a $3 game on sale I can't say it wasn't worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042378458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1535369688}
review: Gophers defending a BBQ against dinosaurs using an assortment of weapons as they spew out terrible jokes and puns... Honestly I loved it. It's quite a simple fun game with a few more challenging but certainly obtainable achievments I would recommend it to anyone who likes a little bit of colourful fun. I don't think I would buy it at full price given its lack of replayability and short campaign but am certainly happy I bought it on sale. So generally if your after a real challenging tower defender this isn't for you but if you're happy with a fun tower defender with a few mildly challenging achievments then look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999664164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2151, 'last_played': 1530365492}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007980324', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1561218240}
review:
You'll get the most fun out of this game by trying to 100% it.  It is possible to rush through the game if that's all you want to do.  However, if you attempt to 3-steak every stage, it gets a lot more interesting.  The achievements are a fun challenge as well.

I really liked how it took your typical tower defense game and added a puzzle element.  For many stages, it feels like there is only one possible combination of weapons and order of placement to get the 3-steak.  You feel clever figuring it out.

There are some things the game could have done better.  The music is ultimately forgettable - it's fine - it's just middle of the road.  Weapons cannot be upgraded.  And the store items are mostly pointless.  Other than the splodey barrel and the spikes, there's no incentive to collect coins.

I feel I got my money's worth, and if they make a sequel, I'll get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961951106', 'num_games_owned': 1558, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1528639369}
review: Despite its "childish" appearance, this is a decent game. Sadly it suffers from that common pitfall of tower defense, where some turrets are much better than others and you have little reason to use some of them. The laser is a particularly good example of this - unlocked as one of the earliest turrets in the game and almost not used at all in worlds 2 and 3 because of the level layouts. The voice acting is corny, but not terrible. The levels are fairly well thought out but not too difficult. The whole thing feels very refreshing and relaxing in how unpretentious it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099067825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1377028334}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012731829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1526506334}

author: {'steamid': '76561198256291224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1525363997}
review:
Pro:
- mix of puzzle and tower defense. It's a unique system of tower placement a la Tetris.
- meaningful tower types, good variety
- hero character and power ups for it
- easy unlock system for costumes, towers and power ups
- many different maps, no track recycles
- though the levels are moderately difficult at best, there are challenging achievements
- variety in dinosaurs
- presence of dinosaurs

Neutral:
- character costumes are purely cosmetic. It would be neat if they also added abilities unique to them.
- some achievements don't unlock, though most seem to work fine

Con:
- music gets annoying after the first two or three maps, if not before
- voice of gopher (hero) is the most annoying thing I ever heard 
Neither is an issue though; the voice can be muted (as well as effects and the music).

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 1253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1524365775}
review:
Good casual tower defense game.  Not too difficult and perfect for kids or casual adult gamers.  The graphics are fun, the sound and music are fun, and the progression is good as you move through the 60 levels.  Progression allows you to add more objects on the field.  Some of these objects are different devices that shoot in different ways.  Some freeze them, some use lasers to hit multiple targets, and more.  Other objects are one time use objects such as a bomb, or an invite to 3 other friends to give you 4 shooters.  Your main character is also a shooter at all times.  While you can build different towers, you also get to use your character to attack the dinosaurs.  Your character adds as a hero in a sense where entire battles can be won just using your character and not build a single tower.  The dinosaurs vary and are quite different.  Some dinosaurs fly, some run, some go really slow.  Some are easy to kill while others take a lot of hits to go down.

Overall you must stop the dinosaurs from eating your steak on your BBQ.  If all three steaks are eaten, then you lose the round and must start over.  The achievements are fairly easy on this game.  If you are good, then you may find the last achievement of killing 10,000 dinosaurs a bit of grind, but it's not an impossible grind and doesn't take that long to accomplish.  Overall, I'm glad I played this game and recommend it if you are looking for a casual tower defense game.

- "action tower-defense", bo walutÄ™, tzn. orzechy kokosowe ("kokosy"!) trzeba zbieraÄ‡ szybko i zrÄ™cznoÅ›ciowo, co trochÄ™ zniechÄ™ca

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1643039607}
review:
Tags: Tower Defense
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Straightforward and fairly simple casual tower defense aimed at a young audience. Defend steaks from disonaurs. Niche and derivative.

Cant fault this tabletport grade game. It has solid PC resolutions support. Excellent art direction. Solid tablet3D engine that is colorful without blaring backlight in your retina. The little card deck of towers that you unlock with coconuts is vaguely reminding me of PvZ. Tetris shaped towers means emplacement considerations have to be taken. The understaffing of the player with offensive power means he has to manage the one mobile tower across the battlefield, a deadly mole slinging rocks with a maniacal smile on. Foes are colorful dinosaurs. Instead of getting stars every level your success is measured in steaks xD

On the negative side the game could had used more microdetailing and texturing for its assets, and the audio clips and taunts, while very lively, slant a tad too much towards the childish tone to really not be cringeworthy at times to a general audience.

The fact that you can move a defender around fast around the map, while also spawning more convential towers by dragging and dropping cards was a fairly good idea. Adding multiple elements for the player to keep track of and adding flexibility while still remaining very accessible and readily understood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167173649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1593261741}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs mixes tower-defense with tetris-like towers. I like this because you then have to plan what towers to use on which level, some you like may not be able to fit on some levels, this actually makes sure all towers are used and not just a select few.

It runs very well, the cutscenes are cute and I am having a blast with the levels. 
Achievements are not hard to get, I assume they have lower-clear rate because people got bored of the game as I do feel the first few levels are slow because of the lack of towers unlocked but any tower-defense game has this so I do not mind it. Bear through the first few slow levels and then the fun starts once you unlock more towers.

You can use new towers in earlier levels too which is nice as often tower-defense games don't allow you to do this.

Only issue with the game is the characters voice, however you can turn that off in options so thank you developers.


It is fun, however maybe not as fun as other's in the same genre so I would wait for a discount unless you really like what you see if you watch some videos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121076471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1628991755}
review: I love this game! If you're a fan of tower defense games- you'll love this! One of my biggest gripes for tower games is everything is so small and cluster-fucked on the map, sometimes I can't even see the creeps through all the tower projectiles. That's no problem for Go Home Dinosaurs! I see a lot of reviews saying this game is too easy. World one is pretty much a tutorial until level 12 or 14. It's pretty much: New tower, here's a couple levels with obvious placement choice- new tower.. ETC. After that, the difficulty increases, and the maps are less obvious. You need to actually look at the map, see what towers you should take and how you're going to space them before every map begins. That's TRUE strategy! I just failed a level 3 times in a row on the second world, until i finally found a tower set up that worked. It was fun trying new combinations based on the squares I had available. Also, it's super cute! 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019479423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1809, 'last_played': 1499562002}
review:
EDIT: 
Got all the achievements at this time (something about 30 hours). I have to say that i didn't spend that whole time playing, but I'm pretty sure it has something 'bout 20 hours to reach all the achievements if you are not as slow as me.

I let the original review below, without any changes. I really loved to play the game. Very simple, but very fun.

-----------------------------------------
ORIGINAL: 
I'm still running after some achievements, but I can already say that this is a good game. I got it some days ago, in a Summer sale. It was very cheap for the amount of fun that I took from this game.

First of all, you need to like Tower Defense games, but you don't need to be a very strategic person, since this game doesn't have a lot of units and enemies. It's simple, but it's still very cool to play, specially if you're looking for a game to chill and have a break sometimes.

The achievements are not very hard to obtain, which is not actually something bad, since the game is supposed to be short.

Although it's short, it has very unique and well made graphics, with some cute units, while the sound effects are Ok, nothing special about it. At least the sounds from the units are funny.

The game itself is very simillar to Plants vs. Zombies, which I love and played a lot. So if you like that game, you'll probably like this one too.

Overall: 8.5/10. It could be longer, with some more difficult and different modes.

Anyway, I would recommend to anyone who's looking for some cheap, fun, simple and relaxing game. Give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077147190', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1486494349}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs! ist ein kunterbuntes Tower Defense-Spiel. Hier versuchen die ErdmÃ¤nnchen, die Dinos davon abzuhalten, ihre Grillsteaks zu mampfen.

Um die Dinos fernzuhalten, baut man TÃ¼rme, die wie bei den Tetrisformen jeweils eine andere GrundflÃ¤che brauchen. Die TÃ¼rme kauft man mit KokosnÃ¼ssen, die man mit seinem Helden manuell sammeln muss. Der Held ist frei steuerbar und kann auch Steine auf die Dinos werfen oder Felsen aus dem Weg rÃ¤umen, um einen Bauplatz freizumachen.

Zu Beginn eines Levels wÃ¤hlt man eine Anzahl an Karten. Mit einer Karte kann man dann entweder einen bestimmten Turm bauen oder eine FÃ¤higkeit einsetzen. Beides kostet KokosnÃ¼sse. Man kann also nicht das Spielfeld beliebig vollpflastern, sondern muss haushalten und immer wieder die auftauchenden KokosnÃ¼sse sammeln.

Das Spiel selbst ist nicht so schwer, wie einige andere Tower Defense-Spiele. Wenn man allerdings alles makellos (3-Steaks) abschlieÃŸen will, muss man bei ein paar Level einige Male auf Neustart klicken.

Im Spiel sammelt man auch MÃ¼nzen, mit denen man dann im Shop neue KostÃ¼me oder FÃ¤higkeiten kaufen kann. FÃ¼r 2500 MÃ¼nzen kann man sogar einen GemÃ¼semodus (ohne Steaks halt...) freischalten.

Die Spielzeit betrÃ¤gt ca. 5-6 Stunden. Dann hat man alle 60 Level durch. Wer alle Achievements will, braucht hierfÃ¼r etwa die doppelte Zeit.

Ich finde die einsetzbaren TÃ¼rme und die Karten sehr abwechslungsreich. Das Spiel hat sowohl eine Menge Humor, als auch eine gute Grafik. Insgesamt zÃ¤hlt es fÃ¼r mich locker zu den besten Tower Defense-Spielen, die ich bisher gespielt habe. Daher kann ich Go Home Dinosaurs! einfach nur wÃ¤rmstens empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1487765911}
review:
Incredibly boring Tower Defense game...

Go home dinosaurs is casual strategy game with some elements from Tetris. It has cute graphics, nice sound effects. Very polished game without any bugs. There is only one big problem - gameplay is boring. I will try to explain.

- There are only 5 towers and 5 units in the first 20 levels. 
- The look of the levels is always the same. Only the road changes direction. There is always 1 road. Mobs go through themselves one by one from the point A to the point B. Every level...
- There are no upgrades between levels. Actually, there is nothing between levels except new skins for main character
- There are no difficulty levels. The only one is very very easy.
- There are no types of damage/armor, no numerals of health and damage. There is no strategy. It's just another casual clicker game

I was forced by myself to reach World Two. I was hoping to see something new. I was wrong.
There were same 1 road levels with another skin (it was a desert. WoW!). 
I wasted an hour of my life by playing this game.

I think, people who never played TD games and children could find this game interesting.
I can't recommend this game for anybody to buy even on a sale!

review:
[h1] Genre: Tower Defense [/h1]

Go Home Dinosaurs ist ein Tower Defense-Spiel, wo der Held ein Murmeltier ist. Deine Aufgabe besteht darin, gegen verschiedene Dinosauriertarten zu kÃ¤mpfen und diese abzuwehren, den die Dinosaurier wollen an das frisch gegrillte Barbecue heran und versuchen den Grill zu stehlen. Fast wie in jedem Tower Defense muss man seine VerteidigungstÃ¼rme gezielt plazieren, diese spÃ¤ter ausbauen und Ã¼berlegen, welche Strategie am besten geeignet ist, um die Horden abzuwehren. 

[h1] Positiv [/h1]

+ schÃ¶ne Grafik
+ viele Ebenen, die es zu meistern gilt
+ auch fÃ¼r Kinder geeignet

[h1] Negativ [/h1]

- zu einfach

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Go Home Dinosaurs ist ein solides Tower Defensespiel geworden, das vor allem SpaÃŸ mitbringt. FÃ¼r NeuankÃ¶mmlinge in diesem Genere ist es ein guter Einstieg. FÃ¼r Hardcore-Fans hat es wenig zu bieten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076093453', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1687358364}
review:
I really really enjoyed this game.
As far as it goes, its a good 3D tower defense that works up for it's cutesy style with challenging levels (if you want to get fully complete! Also boss battles!)

So yeah
==========
Start with the obvious:
+Cutesy graphics
+Customizable characters (dont want to play this boy/girl gopher? Play a ninja one instead, or a chef! etc)

+Purchase 'towers' and 'character skins and buffs' with coconuts that appear around the map

+Challenge if you want all 3 stars per level; some levels I had to redo on hours to get them

+Bosses can be a bit difficult

+Vegan friendly mode, you can purchase an option to play with carrots instead of steaks in the game's shop (in-game currency, not real money).

+Characters take up space, and the whole map is a grid, so some characters wont fit if you don't think about it first, that aspect was neat! You can put them anywhere.

+Cheap and long, i have 6 hours in kingdom rush with all stars on levels
this game took me wayyy longer than that, and i still havent finished the last level yet.

+It has a lot of cute animations, and each dinosaur is animated/has different move speeds. Theres also winter levels with snowy hats and scarves, some models are the same but have different clothing, so it's individually cute! 

------------
Cons?
I had some issues with sound, but sometimes I think its just my pc!
Overall this game was REALLLYY enjoyable and can be challenging for adults too, (I'm 23) and I recommend totally!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1468846468}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs is an action/tower defense game with puzzle and card game elements. You unlock various towers as you progress through the levels in the form of cards, and before every new level, must choose a set of cards from your collection for use within the level.
Each card (tower) requires resources, which are coconuts and they spawn at random times throughout the level, meaning that you are constantly watching for the next coconut tree in order to gather resources so you can place your towers.
The "action" element comes from not only having to click coconuts, but clearing boulders and knocking down snowmen on some levels to make room for towers, and all while trying to get your squirrel into position to do damage when it's not collecting resources/clearing terrain as your main character also functions as a mobile tower.

It's not a traditional tower defense game, it requires much more hands on and faster reactions than most. There's no planning in advance, the dinosaurs travel along predetermined paths, so there's also a puzzle element regarding which tower cards to choose to be most effective on any particular level. It's well presented cartoon graphic style and sound effects are enjoyable.
The only negative I have is that even though I love tower defense games, this was a little too much action and not enough strategy. If you like TD games, I advise watching some gameplay videos on youtube before you make a purchase as it might not be what you are expecting.

review: This game might fool you into thinking it's just for little kids. I'm sure little kids would love it, but as an adult, I also loved it. If you enjoy relaxing games that do present a challenge, this game is perfect. (Games like tower defense, Plants vs. Zombies, Snood, Agario, etc). It does have a bit of a juvenile feel to the graphics and sound, but that makes it great for a day that you're stressed and need something light-hearted to lift you up. I thoroughly enjoyed it, found it addicting, and thought it was a great bargain.

Not a very long game, but so very adorable!

review:
This is a fun little game.  The jokes are a little corny, but I spent quite a bit of time trying different strategies on each level to 'three steak' every one of them.  I recommend it as a very good time killer.

And when in doubt, keep a few exploding barrels for when the dinos get too close.  I didn't use many of the powerups but those worked wonders.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113497432', 'num_games_owned': 5885, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1458518226}
review:
[h1]Surprisingly fun[/h1]

[b]A puzzle/Tower defense kind of game.
Im not the biggest fan of the Tower Defense but this game made me more interested about the genre.[/b]

The biggest difference, is that theres a strategy going in into a level, rather then after, which makes it more of a casual experience and therefore something that leaves me less anxious. I dont need to move units around or upgrade them, or even worry of what its going on the other side of the map.
Here, the strategy rellies on analizing the space, see what units fit and how effective will they be against the shown enemy tipes. Stages are small and rather short and the maximum number of Cards/units is never higher than 10.

The only issue is that a game like this, clearly made for a young audience, ends up being rather short when it does not increase the difficulty from level to level. So short so, that even after going for the achievements i'm still left with a lot of grinding left to do to reach "Send 10,000 Dinos home"

[b]In sum, i enjoy the most important things about this game, the mechanics are great, i like the flow of the game, i like how it looks...but Dammit, those Voices are really aggravating![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197987710950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1456599791}
review:
Das Spiel ist auch ein tolles Tower Defense fÃ¼r jung und alt. 

Positiv
+ witzige Dinos
+ tolle Grafik

author: {'steamid': '76561198043495274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1448919407}
review:
AchetÃ© pendant les soldes steam, je recommande ce petit jeu mais pas Ã  son tarif initial. 

En effet, bien que trÃ¨s esthÃ©tique et rapidement pris en main, ce tower defence agrÃ©able aux idÃ©es sympathiques ne vaut pas selon moi ses 10â‚¬. La difficultÃ© est largement jouable, les cartes sont assez Ã©videntes mÃªme s'il faut reprendre parfois quelques niveaux pour s'assurer de garder les 3 steaks sur le BBQ. Les succÃ¨s steam semblent essentiellement basÃ©s sur le farming. Le design est mignon Ã  souhait et le jeu en lui mÃªme est trÃ¨s plaisant. 

Donc voilÃ , pour moi c'est Ã  considÃ©rer comme un petit jeu, addictif, Ã  durÃ©e de vie assez courte.
A farm pour collectionner les costumes de notre personnage + les succÃ¨s.
En solde, adoptez le pour quelques heures de fun ! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043835726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1447375648}
review:
Your objective is to protect your steaks at all costs from several types of dinosaurs and send them home once and for all. Go Home Dinosaurs! is a simple tower defense game with 3 different worlds. Each world has around 20 levels with different paths and while some of them might prove a challenge itâ€™s all up about finding a decent strategy in order to complete the level. As you advance in the game you will unlock different cards that gives you other types of defenses, some are used to slow down the dinos while others can put them at the starting point or even make them smaller and therefore, weaker. 

The game is pretty much violence free and the bright colours are inviting if you want to play this game side by side with a younger player. In order to promote their own creativity and their decision making skills. The strategy in which tools to choose as well finding the best alternative when spending your coconuts to buy more allies can be a good incentive to play and thereâ€™s a decent amount of levels and hours to be spent specially considering the low price (if discounted). 

By the end of each world you will have a final Boss. Each boss is bigger and while slow, he doesnâ€™t stop. Right before your enemies reach your precious steaks you have two sets of dinomite [i](eh!)[/i] that will prevent them from reaching them, however you will lose one steak. If you no longer have this final defense with you itâ€™s game over and in the final bosses this wonâ€™t stop them. I finished all the levels while repeating some of them for a perfect level (or because I was failing them) in around 10 hours and I had a fun time with the game. I believe itâ€™s a good choice to play between those heavy AAA titles or just for a quick-short distraction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050918249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1515928391}
review:
This game is a really cute tower defense game.  Great for a casual gamer especially.  It is not particularlly hard to beat all three worlds (which have about 20 levels each in them I believe) but it is increasingly hard to get three stars in them all.  It gets more and more hectic as you go along.  

It's very colorful and has great animation.  This is a great one to pick up on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962767542', 'num_games_owned': 3169, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1443831250}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs est un tower defense au graphisme cartoon/enfantin, dans lequel vous devez dÃ©fendre les steaks de votre barbecue contre une horde de dinosaures.
Le bestiaire du jeu est variÃ©, vous y trouverez une dizaine de dinosaures, trex, stegosaures, raptors etc. ; Au fur et Ã  mesure de votre progression Ã  travers les 60 niveaux du jeu, vous dÃ©bloquerez de nouveaux pouvoirs, trÃ¨s sympa et originaux (Un DJ dont les ondes font des dÃ©gÃ¢ts, 3 pnj qui balancent des boules de neiges etc.).
Les 60 niveaux sont bien rÃ©flÃ©chis, vous obligeant par moment, Ã  varier vos habitudes et Ã  changer de power-up, selon la configuration du parcours, ou selon les dinosaures qui vous attaquent. 
Je regrette personnellement la taille des cartes, dont le parcours aurait pu Ãªtre allongÃ©, finalement nous ne plaÃ§ons que quelques power up (9 maximum) par niveau, rendant la partie trÃ¨s rapide.
Au niveau des succÃ¨s comptez entre 12 et 14 heures pour le terminer Ã  100%. Peu de difficultÃ© pour tous les obtenir, mÃªme si avoir tous les niveaux avec 3 steaks peut par moment s'avÃ©rer plus compliquÃ© sur certaines cartes ; Je vous conseille de finir le jeu une premiÃ¨re fois, et revenir sur les niveaux oÃ¹ vous n'avez pas eu les 3 steaks plus tard, une fois que vous avez tous les power-up.
Le dernier succÃ¨s qui demande les 10,000 kills vous obligera Ã  le farmer un petit peu. J'ai terminÃ© le jeu et tous les autres succÃ¨s avec 6,000 dinosaures tuÃ©s.

Les + :
- Le graphisme efficace
- Le bestiaire en quantitÃ© suffisante
- Les niveaux sont rÃ©flÃ©chis et la difficultÃ© bien dosÃ©e
- L'originalitÃ© des power-up

Les - :
- Des parcours trop courts
- La musique rÃ©pÃ©titive
- Le succÃ¨s des 10,000 kills, long et rÃ©pÃ©titif

Les SuccÃ¨s :
- Solo : Oui
- Multi : Non
- DurÃ©e : Entre 12 et 14 Heures
- DifficultÃ© : Normale

author: {'steamid': '76561197961547407', 'num_games_owned': 2112, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1437572522}
review: This is a small format touch screen game. I suppose on a touch screen it would be a better gameplay experience, but I found myself at odds with the gameplay while using a mouse.  It's a fixed path tower defense game, and while I typically enjoy this specific form of the genre, there isn't enough to keep my attention here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062822964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1434758914}
review:
Go Home Dinosaurs a tower defense game where you play a gopher having a barbeque where Dinos then invade in an attempt to take your food.

Visually the game is bright and has a cartoonish childish look to it that soon grows tiresome to look at. The gameplay here is what kills it. It is incredibly slow to play. Unlike most tower defense games now there is no speed up button to advance gameplay forward at a faster pace. So because of this you are forced to trudge through slow moving enemies advancing forward. You also can not upgrade the towers you do build and are forced to find places to put them since they all take up different amounts of spaces and angles. 

You also control the main character himself who can go around throwing coconuts at the enemy. The main problem with this game though is just the lack of fun I found myself not having while playing it. Between the slow gameplay and the fact that the game provided little challenge I just found myself growing bored too quickly with not much in game to keep me wanting to advance into the further stages.

Overall there are hundreds and thousands of better tower defense games out there one could play. This one is lacking gameplay features and fun factor while being made for a younger crowd. Even on a Steam sale I just can't recommend this.


Score :


2/10


http://apocalypticdemise.com/2015/07/03/go-home-dinosaurs-review/
